progression_balancing.description:
A system that can move progression earlier, to try and prevent the player from getting stuck and bored early.
A lower setting means more getting stuck. A higher setting means less getting stuck.

accessibility.description:
Set rules for reachability of your items/locations.
Locations: ensure everything can be reached and acquired.
Items: ensure all logically relevant items can be acquired.
Minimal: ensure what is needed to reach your goal can be acquired.

priority_locations.description: Prevent these locations from having an unimportant item

advancement_goal.description: Number of advancements required to spawn bosses.

egg_shards_required.description: Number of dragon egg shards to collect to spawn bosses.

egg_shards_available.description: Number of dragon egg shards available to collect.

required_bosses.description: Bosses which must be defeated to finish the game.

shuffle_structures.description: Enables shuffling of villages, outposts, fortresses, bastions, and end cities.

structure_compasses.description: Adds structure compasses to the item pool, which point to the nearest indicated structure.

bee_traps.description:
Replaces a percentage of junk items with bee traps, which spawn multiple angered bees around every player when
received.

combat_difficulty.description: Modifies the level of items logically required for exploring dangerous areas and fighting bosses.

include_hard_advancements.description: Enables certain RNG-reliant or tedious advancements.

include_unreasonable_advancements.description: Enables the extremely difficult advancements "How Did We Get Here?" and "Adventuring Time."

include_postgame_advancements.description: Enables advancements that require spawning and defeating the required bosses.

send_defeated_mobs.description: Send killed mobs to other Minecraft worlds which have this option enabled.

death_link.description: When you die, everyone dies. Of course the reverse is true too.
